issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toUpperCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.

Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.

To get local formatting use `getDateInstance()`, `getDateTimeInstance()`, or `getTimeInstance()`, or use `new SimpleDateFormat(String template, Locale locale)` with for example `Locale.US` for ASCII dates.

To get local formatting use `getDateInstance()`, `getDateTimeInstance()`, or `getTimeInstance()`, or use `new SimpleDateFormat(String template, Locale locale)` with for example `Locale.US` for ASCII dates.

Use `Double.valueOf(COLUMN_COUNT)` instead
Use `Integer.valueOf(0)` instead

Do not compare java.io.File with `equals` or `==`: will not work correctly on case insensitive file systems! See `go/files-howto`.

Avoid using common ForkJoinPool, directly or indirectly (for example via CompletableFuture). It has a limited set of threads on some machines which leads to hangs. See `go/do-not-freeze`.
Avoid using common ForkJoinPool, directly or indirectly (for example via CompletableFuture). It has a limited set of threads on some machines which leads to hangs. See `go/do-not-freeze`.

Do not use `javax.swing.SwingWorker`, use `com.intellij.util.concurrency.SwingWorker` instead. See `go/do-not-freeze`.

Do not use `SwingUtilities.invokeLater`; use `Application.invokeLater` instead. See `go/do-not-freeze`.
